intro: Miquelia emodi, commonly known as the Indian star anise, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lardizabalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant, star-shaped fruit. The plant produces small, green flowers that develop into dark brown, aromatic seeds. Its fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to star anise. The botanical features of Miquelia emodi make it a unique and valuable species in both ecological and culinary contexts.
